+package com.futurewei.alcor.web.rbac.aspect;
+
+import java.lang.annotation.*;
+
+@Target(ElementType.METHOD)
+@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
+@Documented
+public @interface Rbac {

replies.bodyText: Can you document this new annotation in the design doc? This is good staff.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Pretty important interface. Could you add comments to its methods?
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: What other rbacType do we plan to support?
timeline.author: xieus

+
+package com.futurewei.alcor.common.rbac;
+
+import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Value;
+import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean;
+import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
+
+import java.io.IOException;
+
+@Configuration
+public class RbacManagerConfiguration {
+
+    @Value("${rbac.policy.type: strict}")
+    private String rbacType;

replies.bodyText: There are two rbacType Ignore or strict. Ignore rbac let all requestes access.
replies.author: Gzure

replies.bodyText: Okay thanks. In this case, we would suggest to name the rbacType as Ignore and Enforced.
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText:
One more minor suggestion: rbacType should be "ignored" and "enforced".
Please also update the class name as well.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: We have also a Alcor logger under common lib. do you find anything missing compared to slf4j? If not, maybe a good idea to switch to our own logger :-)
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText:
We have also a Alcor logger under common lib. do you find anything missing compared to slf4j? If not, maybe a good idea to switch to our own logger :-)

Slf4j is a strong log frame. All our own logger features can supported by Slf4j.
replies.author: Gzure

timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Do we plan to have some fun with RbacConfiguration? It is empty for now. :-)
timeline.author: xieus

+

+import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
+

+public class RbacConfiguration {
+}

replies.bodyText: This file is config @componentscan Only, So it have empty body.
replies.author: Gzure
